title: Unfair 14 day ban over a 7 day ban
body: I got for 14 days for flaming a toxic troll adc ahri who built ap and fed. The problem with the ban is i have never been banned before and i feel like it is unfair to give me a 14 day ban before a 7 day ban. Now i'm not receiving my season rewards because i got banned for flaming a troll who was being more toxic than me. On top of that its unfair to ban me for 14 days when ive never been banned before. The banning system should work in steps. 7 days - 14 days - 30 days - perma ban. Also it says that if you were banned for more than 7 days you wont receive the season rewards. So where is my 7 day ban before my 14 day ban. It doesnt make sense to even mention a 7 day ban if no one ever gets one. My friend had 3 acc where he got banned for toxic, feeding, trolling, all of the bans were 14 days. Also it says that if you get banned after August 22 you will not receive rewards. So your telling us getting banned before august 22 is ok but after that you lose rewards because of 1 bad game with a troll duo bot lane? Can someone at riot explain how the banning system works. I've never seen a 7 day ban. How does one receive a 7 day ban over a 14 day ban?

replies.body:
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/9EVf5ytF-rule-clarification-for-the-punishment-system-in-league-of-legends

The system is pretty easy to understand.. you just need to read it. 

Punishment tiers:

10 game chat restriction

25 game chat restriction

14 Day ban.

Permanent ban.

There are a few stipulations to this. Punishment tiers are not fully based on severity, rather on repeated toxicity after your initial warning. Also, If you use extreme hate speech/threats, the system can skip punishment tiers and take you straight to a 14 day ban (some cases even permanent.)

If you play 5-6 months of continuous good behavior, you will go down in punishment tiers.

A 14 day ban is your final warning before getting permanently banned. Any amount of toxicity no matter how minor is a sign that you are not reformed, and will result in a permanent ban. If you receive a 14 day ban you are on your very last chance.
